animal_concentrations.References: (1) Johnson-Restrepo B et al; Environ Sci Technol 39: 8243-50 (2005)
animal_concentrations.Value: In samples collected from coastal waters of Florida, 2,2',3,4,4',5,5',6-octabromodiphenyl ether was detected in dolphins (ng/g lipid) as follows; bottlenose dolphin (western coast, 1991-1996) 46.5, bottlenose dolphin (eastern coast, 2000-2001) <0.003, bottlenose dolphin (eastern coast, 2001-2004) <0.003, and striped dolphin 9.4(1).

fish_seafood_concentrations.References: (1) WHO; Environmental Health Criteria 162. Brominated Diphenyl Ethers. Geneva, Switzerland: WHO (1994) (2) Johnson-Restrepo B et al; Environ Sci Technol 39: 8243-50 (2005)
fish_seafood_concentrations.Value: In Japan, octabromodiphenyl ether was not detected in 75 fish samples in 1987 and was not found in 144 fish samples collected in 48 areas in 1988-89 (detection limit, 5 ug/kg wet wt)(1). In samples collected from coastal waters of Florida, 2,2',3,4,4',5,5',6-octabromodiphenyl ether was detected in teleost fishes (ng/g lipid) as follows; silver perch 1.0, striped mullet 0.1, spotted seatrout <0.003, red drum 0.9 and hardhead catfish 0.7; in stingrays (ng/g lipid) as follows; Atlantic stingray <0.003; in all sharks at <0.003 ng/g lipid including spiny dogfish, Atlantic sharpnose, bull shark (1993-1994) and bull shark (2002-2004)(2).

sediment_soil_concentrations.References: (1) WHO; Environmental Health Criteria 162. Brominated Diphenyl Ethers. Geneva, Switzerland: WHO (1994) (2) Kohler M et al; Environ Sci Technol 42: 6378-84 (2008)
sediment_soil_concentrations.Value: SEDIMENT: In 1987, environmental surveys were conducted concerning octabromodiphenyl ether in bottom sediment. Octabromodiphenyl ether was detected in 3 of 51 samples at concentrations of 8-21 ug/kg in 1987 ( detection limit, 7 ug/kg dry wt) and was detected in 3 of 135 samples, collected at 45 areas, at concentrations of 15-22 ug/kg dry wt (detection limit, 5 ug/kg) in 1988-89(1). Octabromodiphenyl ethers concentration in Greifensee Lake, a small eutrophic lake in Switzerland, increased from 0.03 ng/g dry weight in 1974 to 0.14 ng/g dry weight in 2001(2).

sediment_soil_concentrations.References: (1) Eljarrat E et al; Chemosphere 71: 1079-86 (2008) (2) Li K et al; Bull Environ Contam Toxicol 81: 588-93 (2008)
sediment_soil_concentrations.Value: SOIL: 2,2',3,3',4,4',5',6-Octabromodiphenyl ether was reported in agricultural soil treated with sewage sludge at field sites in Spain at concentrations of not detected to 2.07 ng/g dry weight, respectively(1). Octabromodiphenyl ether was not detected in 20 of the soil samples taken from 15 urban and 6 industrial sites in Taiyuan, China sampled Jan 2006, one site had reported levels of 0.017 ng/g(2).
